decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage efficiently. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner, as well as burn spells like Play with Fire and Wizard's Lightning, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Den of the Bugbear helps ensure the deck has a consistent flow of threats and damage output. The companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, adds additional utility and versatility to the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and enchantments, while also utilizing Yorion as a companion for additional value. The deck features a mix of powerful creatures like Glissa Sunslayer and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines, as well as key enchantments like High Noon and Leyline Binding to disrupt opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements, allowing for consistent access to all the necessary colors of mana.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and efficient spells. It utilizes cards like Smuggler's Copter and Spyglass Siren to maintain tempo while also incorporating artifact synergies like Ensoul Artifact and Case of the Filched Falcon for additional value. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck's mana base. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells, this deck combines speed and versatility to quickly put pressure on the opponent and secure victories in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful ramp spells combined with removal and counterspells. By ramping into powerful threats like Omnath, Lotus Cobra, and Nissa, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents while also controlling the board with cards like Portable Hole and Get Lost. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion that can reset the board and provide additional value. The deck aims to dominate the mid to late game with its powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on utilizing auras to build up a powerful, aggressive board presence. By enchanting creatures with cards like Ethereal Armor and All That Glitters, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with large, evasive threats. The inclusion of cards like Stubborn Denial and Shardmage's Rescue help protect key creatures, while cards like Curious Obsession and Staggering Insight provide additional card advantage and evasion. With the help of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck can maintain a consistent game plan and pressure opponents early and often.

This deck revolves around the synergy between Lotus Field and various untap effects to generate large amounts of mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to ramp up to big spells like Emergent Ultimatum, Omniscience, and Peer into the Abyss, which can either win the game outright or set up a winning board state. The deck also has some protection in the form of Boseiju, Who Endures and Nine Lives to help stall against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful plays.

The deck revolves around utilizing Transmogrify to turn smaller creatures into powerful threats, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Reckoner Bankbuster, to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes interaction and disruption options like Fatal Push and Thoughseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's gameplan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Duress to further disrupt the opponent's hand. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and a variety of utility lands to support the combo strategy.

The deck aims to combo off by using Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Hidetsugu Consumes All. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower. The deck also utilizes Case of the Stashed Skeleton to potentially reuse key cards from the graveyard. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. The overall strategy is to assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This Boros Control deck focuses on slowing down and controlling the game through a mix of removal spells, card draw, and disruptive spells. By using cards like High Noon, Caretaker's Talent, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, as well as utilizing powerful cards like The Wandering Emperor and Sunfall, this deck aims to outlast its opponents while building up its own resource advantage. With a mix of utility lands like Westvale Abbey and Field of Ruin, as well as a solid mana base, this deck is designed to disrupt opponents while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to build a powerful green mana base and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By using cards that increase devotion to green, such as Leyline of the Guildpact and Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner, the deck can quickly ramp up its mana production. This allows for the early casting of strong creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll, backed up by support cards like Storm the Festival and Ulvenwald Oddity. The deck aims to establish board dominance and pressure the opponent relentlessly.

This deck focuses on using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, enabling powerful combo plays. Cards like Archdruid's Charm, Hidden Strings, and Pore Over the Pages help to untap Lotus Field and dig for combo pieces. Strict Proctor is used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Fae of Wishes provides versatile access to sideboard options. The deck also includes Lier, Disciple of the Drowned for recursion and Bala Ged Recovery for additional graveyard interaction. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful combo cards, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays.

This deck focuses on using Lotus Field and other cards to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and combos. Key cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings help untap Lotus Field for even more mana acceleration, while cards like Pore Over the Pages and Dark Petition help dig for answers and win conditions. The goal is to set up a board state where you can cast game-winning spells like Emergent Ultimatum or Omniscience to overwhelm your opponent and secure the victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on maintaining a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle by using low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize for disruption and Fatal Push for removal, while Jegantha functions as a companion to provide additional value. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on utilizing small, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero alongside burn spells like Monstrous Rage and Titan's Strength to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck's mana base. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Reckless Rage to clear the way for its creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This deck focuses on using Transmogrify to convert low-cost creatures into powerful threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Ob Nixilis, the Adversary. By controlling the board with removal spells and disruption like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to set up its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big threats. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion creature for additional flexibility. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outpace the opponent through a combination of efficient removal, disruption, and powerful combo plays.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing counterspells, card draw, removal, and planeswalkers to out-value the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own win conditions, and ultimately win through incremental advantage. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the pace of the game, the deck aims to gradually wear down the opponent and secure victory through attrition. The mana base is designed to support the dual-color requirements of the deck while also providing utility lands to help control the battlefield.

This Aggro deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from exile. The deck includes a mix of low-cost spells and card draw to efficiently cycle through the deck and ensure the Phoenixes can be brought back multiple times in a game. Brazen Borrower provides tempo control, while Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder help with graveyard fill. The deck also includes some protection with Spell Pierce and removal with Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with repeated Phoenix attacks.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Arclight Phoenixes while disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient removal spells and counterspells. The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix while also drawing cards to maintain momentum. Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder are used to help with graveyard filling and ensure consistent access to Arclight Phoenix. The deck also includes disruptive threats like Brazen Borrower to further disrupt the opponent's plans while maintaining pressure on the board.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Vaultborn Tyrant. It also includes cards like Get Lost and Chained to the Rocks to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to quickly ramp up to play big threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, as well as Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, in order to play high-cost green creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll. The deck utilizes cards like Storm the Festival to search for more creatures and Leyline of the Guildpact to gain devotion to green. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner helps untap creatures for extra mana generation. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful green creatures and maintain a high devotion to green for maximum effectiveness.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a variety of removal spells and creatures that disrupt their strategies. It utilizes enchantments like Enigmatic Incarnation to search for key creatures and lock down the opponent's resources. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Atraxa, and Kenrith provide additional threats while also supporting the control game plan. With a mix of removal, ramp, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition.

The deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to control the board by sacrificing creatures to fetch powerful creatures or enchantments from the deck. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Portable Hole and Leyline Binding while generating value from enchantments like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck also includes a toolbox of creatures with varying abilities to adapt to different situations. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and includes lands that provide additional utility like Hushwood Verge and Raffine's Tower.

This deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor powerful creatures from the deck, while controlling the board with various removal spells and enchantments. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide extra value through blinking creatures and permanents. The diverse range of creatures in the deck allows for flexibility in dealing with different threats, while the mana base is designed to support the deck's mana requirements and to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes card advantage through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the deck. The mana base consists of a variety of dual lands to ensure consistent mana sources. Overall, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that allows for a strong board presence and potential for a quick victory. It also includes cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bitter Triumph to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is supported by a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that provide card advantage, removal, and mana fixing to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can copy or duplicate other creatures to create powerful combos. It also includes cards that provide card advantage and disruption to control the game. The key strategy is to generate a strong board presence while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. By efficiently utilizing the resources available and making the most out of the deck's synergy, the player aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures and using burn spells to deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, then use spells like Fatal Push and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to clear the way for lethal attacks. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana flexibility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive plays while maintaining a consistent flow of threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some pump spells to increase the efficiency of attacks and removal spells to clear the opponent's creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining pressure on the opponent and finishing them off with a combination of creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by playing efficient creatures and removal spells to quickly drain the opponent's life total. Cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher put pressure on the opponent while removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize help clear the way for your creatures to get in for damage. The deck also utilizes some disruptive elements like Duress and Bonecrusher Giant to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent plays and powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and utilizing combat tricks and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to create a fast and efficient board presence, while also using cards like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage to pump creatures and push through damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency and power to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with speed and aggression to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy using Spirit creatures. The deck focuses on tempo plays and disruption, using cards like Rattlechains and Spell Queller to control the board and protect its creatures. The deck also has a minor card draw engine with Enduring Curiosity and utilizes powerful enchantments like No More Lies and Wedding Announcement to further enhance its aggro game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while maximizing efficiency.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by removing threats, countering spells, and drawing cards to outvalue the opponent. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and efficient board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The deck also utilizes land disruption with Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control of the battlefield and resources to eventually secure a win through attrition and card advantage.
